result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Paul Anthony Pillatsch in court.  Attorney J J. Crawford in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant will retain an attorney. Minutes filed
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Paul Anthony Pillatsch not in court.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Phone call, car trouble. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 11:00 am.

BOND TO COVER 22CM461 & 22CT407 

Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Paul Anthony Pillatsch in court.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant will retain an attorney. Right to attorney options form given; referred to State Public Defenders Office. Defendant given complaint. Total bond set between 22CT407 & 22CM461. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
